summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting court authorization to subpoena documents from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program. The motion argues that four accusers in the indictment received millions from the fund, and their compensation claims are relevant for impeachment at trial to show potential bias or motive.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, accused of conspiring to violate the Mann Act and sex trafficking statutes with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and filed this motion.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell listed on the motion.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired; the victim compensation fund was established by his estate.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to recruit, entice, and transport minors for illegal sexual activity.
Pagliuca is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys who filed this motion on her behalf.
Menninger is listed as an attorney representing Maxwell in this motion.
Everdell is listed as an attorney representing Maxwell in this motion.
Stemheim is listed as an attorney representing Maxwell in this motion.

events.title: Government Begins 3500 Material Production
events.description: The government began producing discovery material (3500 material) to Maxwell's defense team, revealing accusers received compensation from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Fund.

events.title: Court Conference on Witness Designation
events.description: Court conference where the judge ruled that Accuser-3 would be referred to as 'Witness-3' in proceedings.

events.title: Indictment Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on federal charges, though the indictment did not include the allegations from the four accusers in Maxwell's S2 indictment.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Four accusers in the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell received millions from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Fund: Accuser-1 ($5M), Accuser-2 ($1.5M), Witness-3 ($3.25M), and Accuser-4 ($3.5M).

Maxwell's defense argues the compensation fund's protocol rewards accusers who have filed lawsuits or claims against Epstein or his estate, including employees, creating potential bias if Maxwell's prosecution proceeds.
The motion seeks to subpoena specific documents from the compensation program administrator, including claim forms, correspondence, payment checks, and release forms, for impeachment at trial.
Lawyers for Accuser-2 and Witness-3 were instrumental in creating the terms of the compensation fund's protocol.
The defense contends that without these documents, full cross-examination of the accusers regarding potential economic motives is impossible, violating Maxwell's confrontation rights.
